It is interesting to note how closely the Russian-treined Chinese Com-
munists are following the Moscow pettern.
Those who rule China today from Peking
may well apply the Russian program to the grent plain country of northern Chine
were agriculture is largely the production of grain and the same collective
ferns with nechanized euipment may be successfully operated.
However, the
economy of southern and western Chins is largely tied to the cultivation of rice.
Generally speaking,
the rice paddy is necessarily a amall tract of
ground which
does not lend itself to mechanised production.
Furthermore, the Chinese people,
who differ from other
peoples in so many respects, have one outstanding difference -
the people of the north are the lazy, indolent ones while the people of the south
have all the spirit and progressiveness. They are not docile as those of the
north.
If we are going to do something about China it should be done quickly.
The Chinese individusl known to the Old China Hand was on the averge a hardworking,
good-humored citizen who had been taught from erliest childhood
to respect and
revere his elders,
to preotice the virtuea me most admire, of humility, modesty,
tolerance.
The average
Chinese possessed these qualities
plus a fine sense of
responsibility, & willingness to work hard from dawn to dusk.
He thought of
himself first,
of his fanily second, of the little town that he came from third
and of the State

bed fourth.
Now the children are being taken away

produce a

is taught

He is teught that China was a cultured netion when we

seveges.
If the Communist doctrines are taught to the younger
generation for fifteen years there will be no more China as we knew it but an
entirely different
race of people with
whom we or our children shell have to deal.
Therefore it is important that if Chine is to be returned to the company of free
nations we should
do something about it and soon.
The Chinese, particularly those of the south and west, have an intense
love of the good erth.
True, that is almost a biological urge but the Chinese
possess it
to a marked degree.
